perturbation.original_text: 3.1. Subject to Section 3.6 below the price of the Product, excluding the Licensed Programs, is $[*] per Unit. The total price for both of the Licensed Programs together is $[*] per month per Product ("License Fee"). The License Fee shall begin on the date the Product is shipped to a customer and shall be paid by Power2Ship to WLI by the 7th of each month for the prior month (prorated if the Unit was shipped during the prior month) and shall continue for as long as the Product is active on any wireless network. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Power2Ship is obligated to pay the License Fee to WLI for a minimum of 36 months.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1. Subject to Section 3.6 below the price of the Product, excluding the Licensed Programs, is $[*] per Unit. The total price for both of the Licensed Programs together is $[*] per month per Product ("License Fee"). The License Fee shall begin on the date the Product is shipped to a customer and shall be paid by Power2Ship to WLI by the 7th of each month for the prior month (prorated if the Unit was shipped during the prior month) and shall continue for as long as the Product is active on any wireless network. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Power2Ship is obligated to pay the License Fee to WLI for a minimum of 72 months.
perturbation.explanation: Extended the minimum License Fee payment duration to 72 months. This contradicts standard business practices and could raise concerns under state-specific franchise laws or unfair business practice regulations, as it imposes a potentially unreasonable financial burden on the distributor without a clear corresponding benefit. The extended duration might be viewed as an unconscionable term.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State franchise laws, Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) relating to unconscionability

perturbation.original_text: 5.4. When Products are ordered for the GPRS network, Power2Ship must provide one SIM card for every Unit ordered within a maximum of two weeks from the date of order. The Sim Cards have to be placed and tested in the Unit as they are being manufactured at the factory. Failure to provide the SIM cards in time will require re-opening and re-test of the Units in the US at a cost of $[*] per Unit to be paid by Power2Ship.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.4. When Products are ordered for the GPRS network, Power2Ship must provide one SIM card for every Unit ordered within a maximum of 24 hours from the date of order. The Sim Cards have to be placed and tested in the Unit as they are being manufactured at the factory. Failure to provide the SIM cards in time will require re-opening and re-test of the Units in the US at a cost of $[*] per Unit to be paid by Power2Ship.
perturbation.explanation: Reduced the timeframe for providing SIM cards to 24 hours, which is an unreasonably short period. This is not a legal requirement, but can introduce issues if the contract does not give a reasonable amount of time for Power2Ship to provide a SIM card. This can also be viewed as an unconscionable term.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) relating to unconscionability

perturbation.original_text: 7.6. If an invoice is past due by more than 30 days, WLI may discontinue providing technical support to Power2Ship until the invoice is paid. If Power2Ship does not make payment of any amount due and payable hereunder within 60 days of the date of invoice, WLI (without prejudice to any other remedy) shall be entitled to interest on all past due amounts at the lower of eighteen percent (18%) per annum or the highest rate permitted by law, plus reimbursement of all costs incurred in collecting such amounts, including court costs and reasonable attorney fees.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.6. If an invoice is past due by more than 30 days, WLI may discontinue providing technical support to Power2Ship until the invoice is paid. If Power2Ship does not make payment of any amount due and payable hereunder within 10 days of the date of invoice, WLI (without prejudice to any other remedy) shall be entitled to interest on all past due amounts at the lower of twenty-five percent (25%) per annum or the highest rate permitted by law, plus reimbursement of all costs incurred in collecting such amounts, including court costs and unreasonable attorney fees.
perturbation.explanation: Reduced the grace period for late payments to 10 days and increased the annual interest rate to 25%. Many states have usury laws that limit the maximum interest rate that can be charged. A 25% interest rate may be considered usurious depending on the state's regulations.
